Zhonya,s wont protect you from all, but even just that item often stops some of the cheese enough to let you survive (Zed's poke/ult).  And I am not talking about the stasis.  The small bit of armor does take off the edge.

However, I still only really get it if the player is getting leverage on me and I need it.  Usually if I am avoiding most their damage and they aren't bullying me out of lane I don't get it.
Honestly if I'm really struggling against an all AD comp Ill forgo the last damage item and grab a Randuins or Frozen Heart lol.

Usually you won’t want much armor anyway, since they’ll just stack shred and outscale you.  Armor stacking versus full AD only works if you can commit three whole item slots to purely defensive items.  Otherwise, just build your typical damage plus a little HP to survive burst and some early armor to facilitate a strong mid game.  Decide if Tabis would be better than your standard boots (Sorcs for mages, based on enemy likeliness to stack MR).  Consider rushing Seeker’s.  Only upgrade to Zhonya’s if you need the active, and only after finishing at least one other item.  Remember, armor will be most effective mid game before percent pen becomes more common, so you don’t want to overcommit to it.
